definition: subscript/suffix/index
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
double subscript/doubly indexed

sentences.english: Now you can drop the subscripts if you prefer.
sentences.chinese: 現在如果你樂意，可以去掉下標。

sentences.english: In a single-species fluid, the subscript may be dropped.
sentences.chinese: 對於單組分流體，這個下標可以省略。

sentences.english: A new expression node representing the subscript operation.
sentences.chinese: 一個新的表達式節點，表示該下標操作。

sentences.english: Gets the array element using an array of subscripts for each dimension.
sentences.chinese: 使用每個維度的下標數組來獲取數組元素。

sentences.english: Apply subscript formatting to the selected text.
sentences.chinese: 將下標格式應用於所選的文字。

sentences.english: Don't be confused by the subscripts.
I am going to stop putting subscript e.
sentences.chinese: 接下來我不再用下標e了。

sentences.english: Create vectors, subscript arrays, specify for-loop iterations.
sentences.chinese: 創建載體，下標數組，指定循環迭代。

sentences.english: Individual characters in strings can be referenced with array subscript style notation, as in C.
sentences.chinese: 字符串中的各個字符可以通過數組下標符號來引用。

sentences.english: The subscript O and W identify the unweathered and weathered states.
sentences.chinese: 下標O和W分別表示屬於未風化和已風化的狀態。

sentences.english: N And, in your text, it's E sub N.
Avoid subscripting arrays or hashes within loops.
sentences.chinese: 避免在循環中使用下標數組或散列。

sentences.english: In this paper, a static method is presented, which can detect the phenomena of array subscripts crossing over bounds.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出了一個靜態檢測數組下標超界的方法。

sentences.english: Gets the array element by using an array of subscripts for each dimension.
sentences.chinese: 使用每個維度的下標數組來獲取數組元素。
中間劃線，上標，下標元素。

definition: attributive (modifier)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to advertise/to solicit business
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
obscene language
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
to bind/to wrap up/binding (computer science)
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
headlight
self-addressed stamped envelope (SASE)
to prove/to confirm/to corroborate/convincing proof
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
form of words (e.g. inflection, conjugation)/morphology (linguistics)
